description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b0nit","text":"This protocol details how to efficiently purify the recombinant Tau repeat domain from Escherichia coli.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ognm","text":"NOTE : This protocol was optimized for purification of the cysteine-free TauRD (Tau residues 244-371, C291A/P301L/C322A/V337M), but in principle any Tau isoform or mutant could be purified following this method if it is tagged with a His 6 -ubiquitin tag. If cysteines are present, reducing agent should be added to buffers to avoid the formation of disulphide bonds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"51isp","text":"Incubate diluted His 6 -ubiquitin-TauRD protein with   Usp2 ubiquitin protease at   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":53,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":82,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":83,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cc2l9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7q5e3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2eos7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ogcq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qte2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sbnc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b0ief","text":"Dilution of eluted protein is not needed for protease cleavage but recommended to avoid protein precipitation during incubation. Salt dilution is needed for the next purification step, cation exchange chromatography.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1o4lq","text":"Load the cleavage mixture onto a Source S cation exchange column previously equilibrated with cation exchange buffer A.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eodbq","text":"Wash the column with 5 CV of cation exchange Buffer A.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1pu3e","text":"Elute TauRD with a 0-  linear NaCl gradient in   PIPES-NaOH  ,   β-ME (0-50% gradient from cation exchange buffer A to cation exchange buffer B over 10 CV).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":47,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":60,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":63,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"hg06","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"500","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"50","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"2":{"type":"ph","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"","id":0,"number":"6.5"}},"3":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"2","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"98gd0","text":"Analyze eluted fraction by SDS-PAGE and Coomassie blue staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4muo5","text":"Load TauRD-containing fractions onto a Superdex-75 column previously equilibrated with PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f0vpe","text":"Analyze eluted fraction by SDS-PAGE and Coomassie blue staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

to the intrinsic disordered nature of Tau protein, the apparent size observed by size exclusion chromatography is larger than expected.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":117,"style":"sub"}],"key":"cc7mr","text":"TauRD protein contains few Tyr and Trp residues, and therefore the determination of pure protein concentration by OD 280nm is not reliable. We recommend to determine protein concentration of purified TauRD by BCA assay or Coomassie blue staining including a BSA standard curve. Rapid commercial Coomassie protein stain buffers are not recommended since sensitivity for the TauRD is very low. Standard Coomassie blue staining buffer should be used.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"guid":"20829A9DC9CE11EEA47C0A58A9FEAC02","height":472,"id":476611,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"rr.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qtqfbixhx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qtqdbixhx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qtqebixhx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qtqcbixhx.webp","width":550}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":145}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6khfm","text":"For TauRD thiol labelling, the mutation I260C could be introduced in the cysteine-free TauRD. The same purification protocol can be followed but   tris(2-carboxyethyl)phosphine (TCEP) should be added to the size exclusion chromatography buffer in order to prevent the formation of disulfide bonds.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6oeb8","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":24},{"key":2,"length":1,"offset":54}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"32jgs","text":"Approximate yield: from   of bacterial culture around   of pure TauRD are obtained.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"922DDC45CA8B11EE82750A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"concentration"},"1":{"data":{"amount":"2","concentration":"1","error":false,"error_concentration":false,"guid":"922DDCC7CA8B11EE82750A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"2":{"data":{"amount":"8","concentration":"1","error":false,"error_concentration":false,"guid":"922DDD10CA8B11EE82750A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"}}}}}}
